name: Hero Quest (DrNinja)
description:
UPDATED 20/8/17:

This is a fan remake of the classic 1989 board game Hero Quest, built using Unity. 

Hero Quest is a turn based board game that sees four heroes attempting to complete various quests in dungeons filled with monsters controlled by the evil wizard Morcar.

The current version of the game includes:

  • All four heroes; Barbarian, Dwarf, Elf and Wizard.
  • All monster types from the first two quests; Goblins, Orcs, Fimirs, Zombies, Mummys, Skeletons, Chaos Warriors and the Gargoyle.
  • In game sprites have all been created using photos of the original board game.
  • Fight your enemies in combat, search for treasure and  cast spells.
    Added 20/8/17:
  • A.I.: Play as the heroes against dungeon master Morcar who controls all monsters in the game.
  • Save system: Create named heroes who will persist between games (auto saved locally, also saves items and gold between games).
  • Armoury system: You can now use gold earned from quests to purchase weapons and armour to increase the strength of your heroes on their quests (also saved between sessions).
  • Improved UI from original release: New menu system and improved UI graphics.
  • Secret doors: You can now search for and use secret doors.
  • New quest: Players can now choose to play the second quest in the game; The Rescue of Sir Ragnar, in addition to the original quest The Trial.

What isn't yet in the game:

  • Traps
  • Audio/music (your speakers are working fine).
  • Different resolutions (only 1920 x 1080 will work)
  • Quests beyond the first two from the original Hero Quest game
  • The ability to pass items between players during a game

All game interactions are via the mouse (scroll in/out with the scroll wheel and move the camera around by holding down the right mouse button) except you can hit the escape key to bring up the pause menu or exit the game, or press the 'H' key to toggle furniture transparency if you can't see past items like bookcases. 

This is purely a fan project and learning experience and you will likely encounter bugs which I apologize for. Feel free to contact me if you do find any. In particular there is a known bug where if you switch between quests in the same play session (i.e. start quest 1, quit to the main menu and start quest 2) it won't properly remember your heroes/gold. I advise quitting and relaunching the game itself between quests. I have not added support for any resolutions other than 1920 x 1080 (something I will definitely integrate from the start on my next project!). 

If after playing the game you would take a few minutes to fill out a short survey at https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/F8K955N I would be forever grateful. Also feel free to give me a follow on Facebook (Dr Ninja), Instagram (@iamdoctorninja), Twitter (@andrew_mendlik) or get in touch via email through andrewmendlik at gmail dot com.

Enjoy!

Please note: Hero Quest and all it's graphics and designs are copyright 1989 Milton Bradley.
